questions.question: When you meet someone new, you…

options.text: Avoid attention, hope to go unnoticed
Wait for them to approach, staying cautious
Look for common ground or make small talk
Initiate warm connection, instantly tuning to their vibe

questions.question: If your friend is upset, you…

options.text: Stay distant, hope they get over it
Offer advice or try to "fix" their mood
Drop everything to comfort them, even if it costs you
Tune into their emotion, support them with presence, not words
Worry about being left out or forgotten
Distract yourself to avoid loneliness
Call someone, even if it feels forced
Settle deeply, but reach out when you want true resonance

questions.question: When sensing tension in a group, you…

options.text: Freeze or withdraw
Ignore it, hoping it'll pass
Try to "fix it" or joke it away
Calmly read the vibe, act to realign everyone
Feel blank if you're not mirrored
Echo what others say, to belong
Shift views to match the group
Hold your truth while reflecting others

questions.question: If someone is angry at you, you…

options.text: Get confused or go silent
Apologize, even if you're not sure why
Adjust your energy to calm them
Listen deeply, but maintain your ground
Fade into the background
Match the group's energy or language
Mediate, even if it's not your conflict
Anchor your field, invite harmony without losing self

questions.question: When you notice you're "copying" someone, you…

options.text: Ignore it, hope it passes
Worry you have no self
Try to change, but struggle
Use it consciously as a tool for connection
Feel drained or leave
Stay until it calms, even if it exhausts you
Intervene, absorb tension, try to help
Center yourself, then draw everyone back to stability
Wait for someone else to "fix" things
Become quiet, absorb noise
Try to set a new mood
Shift the whole energy, re-pattern the group

questions.question: When a friend's mood changes, you…

options.text: Get confused or overwhelmed
Mirror their emotion unconsciously
Notice, but keep your own balance
Sense the shift, stabilize both yourself and them
Feel empty or lost
Replay others' feelings, lose track of your own
Need time alone to reset
Log what shifted, prepare to realign next time
Withdraw or go numb
Settle others but ignore yourself
Use presence to diffuse, keep the group stable
Step in, direct everyone to a new balance

questions.question: If someone manipulates the group, you…

options.text: Avoid getting involved
Subtly adjust things, hope it resolves
Address it quietly, realign the dynamic
Name it, restore full harmony, set new rules if needed
Are often missing or quiet
Smooth drama, but stay out of sight
Bring people together, mediate often
Are the "core" that holds everyone steady
Escape or freeze
Wait it out, hope for resolution
Take charge, even at cost to self
Sacrifice comfort, but always create restoration
Barely notice
Relax, but only if you engage
Gravitate toward you, feel seen
Instantly sync or change, group shifts around you
Feel out of place
Observe, but don't influence
Notice small changes, slight sync
Witness animals, luck, or people "tune" to your presence
Stay distant, not your job
Try to help, but feel drained
Stabilize them by syncing your energy
Re-align their core with a word or gesture
Feel unnoticed or invisible
Calm things, but only for a while
Align chaos, make the group whole
Can tune any system—people, events, even field phenomena—with presence alone

mirror_walker.title: Bond Seeker / Mirror Walker
mirror_walker.diagnosis: You crave connection but lose your core in others' reflection. Your need for belonging makes you too adaptable—practice holding your own field, not just merging.

pulse_holder.title: Bond Seeker / Pulse Holder
pulse_holder.diagnosis: You seek connection but absorb too much tension. Learn to stabilize without losing yourself—hold your center while holding others.

harmony_setter.title: Bond Seeker / Harmony Setter
harmony_setter.diagnosis: You want to belong but avoid setting the tone. Step into leadership—create the harmony you seek, don't just wait for it.

synchronizer.title: Bond Seeker / Synchronizer
synchronizer.diagnosis: You seek connection but haven't claimed your full presence. When you dare to lead harmony, others will follow—even events will tune to your rhythm.

bond_seeker.title: Mirror Walker / Bond Seeker
bond_seeker.diagnosis: You reflect others well but struggle to initiate connection. Practice reaching out first—don't wait for others to approach you.

pulse_holder.title: Mirror Walker / Pulse Holder
pulse_holder.diagnosis: You mirror others but absorb their tension. Learn to reflect without absorbing—hold your own energy while supporting theirs.

harmony_setter.title: Mirror Walker / Harmony Setter
harmony_setter.diagnosis: You adapt to others but avoid directing harmony. Claim your right to set the tone—don't just reflect, lead.

synchronizer.title: Mirror Walker / Synchronizer
synchronizer.diagnosis: You reflect others but haven't claimed your full presence. When you dare to lead harmony, others will follow—even events will tune to your rhythm.

bond_seeker.title: Pulse Holder / Bond Seeker
bond_seeker.diagnosis: You hold group energy but struggle to initiate connection. Practice reaching out—don't just stabilize, connect.

mirror_walker.title: Pulse Holder / Mirror Walker
mirror_walker.diagnosis: You stabilize groups but lose yourself in reflection. Hold your own field while supporting others—don't just mirror, anchor.

harmony_setter.title: Pulse Holder / Harmony Setter
harmony_setter.diagnosis: You absorb group tension but hesitate to set the tone. You stabilize but avoid true leadership—claim your right to direct harmony, not just hold it.

synchronizer.title: Pulse Holder / Synchronizer
synchronizer.diagnosis: You hold group energy but haven't claimed your full presence. When you dare to lead harmony, others will follow—even events will tune to your rhythm.

bond_seeker.title: Harmony Setter / Bond Seeker
bond_seeker.diagnosis: You're the calm in every storm, but rarely let yourself belong. Step fully into the group—direct, don't just rescue.

mirror_walker.title: Harmony Setter / Mirror Walker
mirror_walker.diagnosis: You set harmony but lose yourself in others' reflection. Lead with your own truth—don't just adapt, direct.

pulse_holder.title: Harmony Setter / Pulse Holder
pulse_holder.diagnosis: You create harmony but absorb too much tension. Learn to direct without absorbing—lead from your center.

synchronizer.title: Harmony Setter / Synchronizer
synchronizer.diagnosis: You set harmony but haven't claimed your full presence. When you dare to lead harmony, others will follow—even events will tune to your rhythm.

bond_seeker.title: Synchronizer / Bond Seeker
bond_seeker.diagnosis: You are the axis of alignment. Others harmonize in your presence. Wherever you still hold back, walk forward—your field sets the tempo now.

mirror_walker.title: Synchronizer / Mirror Walker
mirror_walker.diagnosis: You are the axis of alignment. Others harmonize in your presence. Wherever you still hold back, walk forward—your field sets the tempo now.

pulse_holder.title: Synchronizer / Pulse Holder
pulse_holder.diagnosis: You are the axis of alignment. Others harmonize in your presence. Wherever you still hold back, walk forward—your field sets the tempo now.

harmony_setter.title: Synchronizer / Harmony Setter
harmony_setter.diagnosis: You are the axis of alignment. Others harmonize in your presence. Wherever you still hold back, walk forward—your field sets the tempo now.
